page.title: 17Pimperne Long Barrow.
page.content: Pimperne Long Barrow is said to be the biggest in the country,it is 100m,3m high 30m wide.It was built about 4,000 years ago.It took a long time because it was built with flint and antler tools.It is probably the burial place of a king or a chief and his family.It has never been excavated.From other excavations we think the men who made it were about 1m 73cm tall and the women 1m 63cm.They have good teeth but they had arthritis. Pimperne Round House During the Iron Age about 2,500 years ago there was a settlement of huts made of wattle and daub in Pimperne.A copy of one can be found at Butser Hill in Hampshire.
